required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose-finding of PB-119 Administered Subcutaneously Once Weekly Versus Placebo in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Dose Cohort Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Twelve Once-weekly Subcutaneous Doses of PB-119 to Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM) Not Well-controlled by Metformin Monotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: A phase 2, multicenter study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of twelve once weekly subcutaneous doses of PB-119 to patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) not well-controlled by metformin mono therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel dose cohort, multiple dose study to evaluate the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of different doses of PB-119 to patients with T2DM not well-controlled by metformin monotherapy. Patients will be assessed for eligibility over a 2 week screening period prior to a 4-week run-in period and a 12-week double-blind treatment period.A phase 2, multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel dose cohort study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of twelve once weekly subcutaneous doses of PB-119 to patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) not well-controlled by metformin monotherapy The eligible patients will be randomized to 1 of 3 dose cohorts (A, B, or C). Each patient will subsequently be randomized within the designated cohort to 1) active drug or placebo at a 3:1 active drug:placebo ratio and 2) exclusion from or inclusion in the pharmacokinetic (PK) blood sample collection subgroup at a 3:1 excluded:included ratio

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The change from baseline value of HbA1c will be compared between treatments
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to end of treatment (up to Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: The change from baseline value of Fasting Plasma Glucose at Weeks 2, 4, 8, and 12
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to end of treatment (up to Week 12)

arm_group.description: PB-119 100 μg subcutaneous (SC) once weekly (QW) + Metformin oral (p.o.) Glucophage® (stable dosage)
PB-119 150 μg SC QW + Metformin oral (p.o.) Glucophage® (stable dosage)
PB-119 200 μg SC QW + Metformin oral (p.o.) Glucophage® (stable dosage)
PB-119 Placebo SC QW + Metformin oral (p.o.) Glucophage® (stable dosage)

intervention.description: Each patient will subsequently be randomized within the designated cohort to active drug or placebo
Each patient will subsequently be randomized within the designated cohort to active drug or placebo

Each patient will subsequently be randomized within the designated cohort to active drug or placebo
